website_summaries.verdict: Good for intermediate mushroom hunters to take their knowledge to a higher level.
pros: Good coverage of over 600 species in the United States and Canada
Quality photos and descriptions give useful information in identifying the safety of mushrooms
Also suitable for those interested in more scientific information
cons: Too bulky for carrying with you when foraging for mushrooms

customer_reviews.title: Good reference for edibles, not a good general scientific field guide.
customer_reviews.text: This guide focuses a lot more on whether or not the mushroom is edible. As a grad student in environmental science, I wanted a more general guide that would include things like preferred habitat, substrate, and environmental conditions. If you are looking for a guide for edibles, this should be fine. But if you are more interested in a scientific field guide, this won't be of much help.
customer_reviews.author: Bree Bird

customer_reviews.title: Great book!
customer_reviews.text: Great book with tons of info. Very scientific, and reads like an encyclopedia. This is a great companion book to my field guides. I would not recommend using this or any book alone to identify mushrooms. I use this to verify identifications made with a field guide. Excellent resource.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best beginner book ever! Very safe mushroom hunting. Great photos and illustration!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great starter book. I had so much fun running around taking pictures of all the mushrooms I could find. The relationship between trees and their mushrooms is very interesting. Even the mushrooms that break down dead trees are beneficial. I started late in the season and I still found lots of stuff and lost 25 pounds walking. There's something really satisfying about foraging. Wear good shoes and don't forget your basket and bug spray!
customer_reviews.author: Pandemonia

customer_reviews.title: A real field guide.
customer_reviews.text: These book has helped us loads. The coating on the pages so you can actually take it with you.
customer_reviews.author: mickphyl

customer_reviews.title: Excellent field guide!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent field guide! Pictures help to adequately identify mushrooms found in the field. The descriptions provide a good starting point of knowledge on every mushroom in the book.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Grant

customer_reviews.title: This is a very good read your knowledge of mushrooms that can be harvested ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good read your knowledge of mushrooms that can be harvested to eat or to use as medicine and what mushrooms to avoid
customer_reviews.author: Cg1

customer_reviews.title: ... more for an entire North American fungi encyclopedia with beautiful pictures and great descriptions
customer_reviews.text: This is less for foraging and more for an entire North American fungi encyclopedia with beautiful pictures and great descriptions. Not a field guide.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Mushroom Field Guide
customer_reviews.text: So many excellent pictures and descriptions. Great field guide for any library collection.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Nice book
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know there we're so many different mushrooms, nice illustrations, clear understanding.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Another great survival. Mushroom are under rated and plentiful
customer_reviews.text: I reall have been wanting one of these. Another great survival. Mushroom are under rated and plentiful.
customer_reviews.author: Don H.

customer_reviews.title: Really don’t have any comment
customer_reviews.text: Good price good quality the book was not beat up
customer_reviews.author: halo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very detailed book with great descriptions. Really helpful in Mycology class and beyond.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany A. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Great book
customer_reviews.text: A little bigger than I was hoping but that makes it more comprehensive. Great pictres- we've already harvested using it as a guide.
customer_reviews.author: Postalannie13

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied customer
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful book, vivid color prints. Very helpful and descriptive. Great book to add to a collection of knowledge.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce M.

customer_reviews.title: Field Guide - edible/inedible mushrooms
customer_reviews.text: The best guide that I have seen to distinguish "good" from "bad" mushrooms. Well written with clear descriptions and excellent photographs. Will be using this regularly on mushrooming expeditions.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Hanley

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great book, makes shroom hunting pretty easy. Free food everywhere!
customer_reviews.author: Jennings

customer_reviews.title: Informative but...
customer_reviews.text: Good coverage of species and informative descriptions but not very good photographs.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Brown

customer_reviews.title: As a fairly new hunter, this field guide will ...
customer_reviews.text: As a fairly new hunter, this field guide will be very helpful in identifying mushrooms when I go out to the field.
customer_reviews.author: New Vegan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A great book; it covers many mushrooms that other field guides do not.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A must have book if you are going to forage for wild mushrooms.
customer_reviews.author: The Colorful One

customer_reviews.title: A bible, really
customer_reviews.text: It is a good, comprehensive book, well illustrated. It is also large and heavy, almost like a bible. Useful as a reference at home, definitely not a field guide. For that purpose, I recommend the book written by Thomas Laessoe and published by DK.
customer_reviews.author: Laszlo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: bougt for a friend and she likes it.. plenty of info ty
customer_reviews.author: D R

customer_reviews.title: very nice field guide
customer_reviews.text: great book, great illustrations , photos and sketches nice guide
customer_reviews.author: gonzolips

customer_reviews.title: Good pictures, but too big and hard to understand for beginners
customer_reviews.text: The book was too large for carrying out in the field (over 550 pages), and was VERY scientifically written. I am a biology graduate and still had a hard time deciphering the definitions of this one. Had to use the glossary to explain words in the glossary! Needless to say, it was a bit too specific for me, as a beginner. On the upside, it was very thorough and included MANY species of mushrooms. The pictures were also very helpful for ID. Novice mushroom seekers may benefit with this book, but I will be returning this one for a more basic field guide.
customer_reviews.author: laurajean

customer_reviews.title: A good companion in the woods.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to navigate and make identifications. A great book for the woods and as a companion to other books with recipes!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl H

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great book and pictures, a must have for fungi hunters. Just remember, if you don't know what it is, don't eat it.

customer_reviews.title: An excellent book on mushrooms.
customer_reviews.text: This book was purchased for a nephew who is very interested in mushrooms. He wanted a book with colour photographas concerning mushrooms of North America.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Bean

customer_reviews.title: Quite comprehensive
customer_reviews.text: This book is quite comprehensive dealing with mushrooms. It is a bit challenging to find the mushrooms that you are looking for. I would rate it higher if it was easier to navigate around. But, I imagine that all mushrooms must be in this book.
customer_reviews.author: kphaTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Fairly comprehensive
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact it has keys. I wish it included the common names with the species. They are occasionally listed, but only sparingly.
customer_reviews.author: Meg W

customer_reviews.title: Unless you know the exact name of the mushroom it's ...
customer_reviews.text: Unless you know the exact name of the mushroom it's difficult to find a match especially when it's not organized by region, it also has mushrooms that are known but are listed with vague or no detail.
customer_reviews.author: If can can

customer_reviews.title: book
customer_reviews.text: I attended a class on identifying mushrooms and this book was highly recomended and I under stand why. it is a very good book on this topic.
customer_reviews.author: Adeline M. Chambers

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book as a gift and the owner loves it!
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Good for identifying mushrooms.
customer_reviews.text: My wife is using this to identify edible mushrooms. She harvested about $500 worth of Morels so far. Be careful though.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: North American Mushrooms Guide
customer_reviews.text: The North American Mushroom Guide has been very helpful in our spring time mushroom hunting ventures. We were able to identify many different types of edidble and un edible varieties. We were able to collect and eat several types: morels, snowball, cauliflour fungi. The Morels were far the best.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: good guide
customer_reviews.text: This mushroom guide could use better photographs but it is still the best one out there for hunters and identification.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Eberhart

customer_reviews.title: Good.
customer_reviews.text: Still looking for the one that has ALL Dikarya fungi with macroscopic fruit bodies.
customer_reviews.author: Cloudbuster

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: i'm reading every word, and i'll remember it.... lucky i have books!
customer_reviews.author: Handymike

customer_reviews.title: I am happy with the item
customer_reviews.text: This transaction went well. I am happy with the item. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Champany

customer_reviews.title: Good Picture book "But"
customer_reviews.text: Book has a lot of species of mushroom but wife wasn't happy that it wasn't that easy to figure out all the Scientific terminology that was used for the names of the mushrooms with out using the computer to look up every one she could find just to get a plain name for a mushroom. Just seems that it wasn't thought all the way before publishing leaves a lot unexplained she said but if you like this kind of field book will make you work for answers.
customer_reviews.author: N/A

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: The book is a heavyweight (figuratively and literally) field guide to fungi, but it is hard to locate & identify mushrooms unless you already know your scientific shroom lingo. I found it useless for my southeast area mushrooming, didn't tell me anything more about anything new. If that makes any sense.
customer_reviews.author: MammaJamma

customer_reviews.title: Disapointed
customer_reviews.text: This book was to scientific and required/requires a lot of time effert and education to use. Difficult to use and read!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a good intermediate guide, though not complete
customer_reviews.text: This is a great intermediate's guide. It is not complete and does not pretend to be. This book deals with mushrooms that the intermediate 'shroomer can identify and shows details of toxic ones that could be misidentified as well as the degree of toxicity..
customer_reviews.author: Robert Davis

product_meta.title: North American Mushrooms: A Field Guide To Edible And Inedible Fungi (Falconguide)
